comment: Wonderful teacher! Once you understand his flow, class is fun and he teaches to a level for all to understand. He also won't leave you behind, and encourages asking questions to get where you need to be in terms of understanding the subject at hand

Dr. Wadsworth is a genuine man who loves music theory with a passion. He is not going to treat you unfairly, and you will succeed if you apply yourself. 
He explains concepts in a concrete fashion primarily through verbalization, with small amounts of metaphors. His classroom is inviting and full of goodness. He is also very patient.
I audited his Music Theory II class. He is a very polite man who cares for his students' understanding of the material. Would take him again.

Dr. Wadsworth is extremely knowledgeable. Sometimes he seems to have difficulty simplifying a concept however, he is always willing to help and goes above and beyond for his students! I have taken him for several theory classes and I have truly enjoyed being in his class.

Dr. Wadsworth is a great professor. He explains concepts clearly with multiple examples. He addresses individual students' needs. Expectations are high, but if you pay attention in class it shouldn't be a problem. He accommodated for me when I was struggling with my work. He is also good with email.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Wadsworth is awesome! He is passionate about music, and knows how to work with students! Only two issues that are very minor: 1) He does not believe in 100's for homework (at the end of semester this can easily determine an A from a B) 2) Some of the COMP projects were advanced for an 1st year class . Other than that he is amazing!

This professor is amazing. He is so helpful, communicates with each student individually, gives amazing feedback, and really develops a relationship between the students. He is an excellent teacher, and is so incredibly kind. He taught me a lot. Everyone should take him, he is the best.

"Dr. W." is a great professor even through an online course. He does an excellent job at staying connected with his online students, very understanding if you have a technical problem, and is definitely very knowledgeable in the field of music. He always uploads video demonstrations of the homework and explanations of new concepts in the course.
He's the best professor I had at KSU until now.

Very good teacher. He is to the point with his knowledge of music theory where he can critique and correct the textbook we use. Very impressive. Also he is so good at piano. I love getting to hear him play in class.
Fantastic Theory teacher, I would recommend him to anyone needing to take this class. Also a wonderful and talented pianist, it's nice get to hear him play in class from time to time.

Dr. Wadsworth is one of the best professors that I have had here so far. He is very passionate about what he teaches, and is eager to help students that ask for it. Show up to class, do your best, and you should be fine.
